report_title: IBISWorld | General Warehousing & Storage in the US Apr 2024
executive_summary: General storage and warehousing have benefited from hikes in consumer spending, leading to more shipments of consumer goods and greater demand for warehouse space. Despite the economic environment proving much more challenging during COVID-19 in 2020, the industry experienced growth. E-commerce sales experienced a significant hike in 2020, leading to a substantial boost in revenue. However, the internalization of warehousing by large big-box retailers has tempered outsourcing demand. Nonetheless, both businesses' demand for warehouse space and their likelihood of contracting it from third-party providers have increased, benefiting the industry during the current period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The industry earns much of its revenue from the storage of consumer goods
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industries specializing in warehousing can perform services at lower costs than companies in other industries for which warehousing is a peripheral function. In the retail sector, growing consolidation has led to the proliferation of big-box stores like Walmart and Target. These outlets have since internalized warehousing and distribution functions to lower intermediate costs, slash selling prices, and capture market share.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The boost in e-commerce is posing new challenges to the industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The expansion of e-commerce has presented challenges for the industry. According to Prologis, products sold online take up three times the space in warehouses as those destined for traditional retailers. E-commerce consumption directly influenced a spike in rental fees and wages. Despite increased sales, this surge in overhead costs prevented an expansion in average industry profit and hindered any substantial growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The use of information technology in warehousing has been on the rise
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Companies have increasingly begun to use wireless and mobile internet technology to help track and monitor products from the assembly line to the loading dock. Increasingly globalized markets and demand for faster delivery processes have led companies to integrate supply chain functions to lower costs and reduce inventory.

Corporate profits have recently been strained, pushing businesses to cut expenses by outsourcing logistics and warehouse management tasks to third-party firms, marking a notable industry shift. Gartner's 2021 survey found that 66.0% of logistics leaders increased their logistics outsourcing budget in 2021, and 74.0% expected to expand further within the next two years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Sustained growth in consumer spending will further raise demand for warehousing from manufacturers and retailers as they ship and purchase storage for more consumer goods. Rebounding trade will drive greater demand because foreign manufacturers often require domestic third parties to receive and store products for the US market.

Consolidation in the industry will be spurred by the increasing technological requirements of efficient warehouse management, especially because of the growing market for e-commerce warehousing. Large corporations like Amazon not only lead in e-commerce, but also dominate in warehousing operations. Their internal logistics systems will present ongoing competition to the industrial sector, disrupting traditional business models.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-commerce will continue to place additional space and labor requirements on the industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As businesses without physical stores witness a surge in sales, there will be an afterward hike in demand for third-party warehousing to manage inventory and distribution. Even with substantial investments in inventory tracking software and advanced technology, productivity improvement gains remain meager. Despite this, wages are still expected to hike incrementally over time.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Technological advancements will boost efficiency and productivity
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Advances in real-time data collection through the internet and mobile technology, along with the development of rapid track-and-trace technology, will continue to improve efficiency. Real-time data collection is crucial for vendors. It allows them to quickly and accurately adjust their supply to meet fluctuating demand, improving efficiency and customer satisfaction. Any small enhancements in barcode scanners and inventory systems can significantly boost a company's productivity, enhance efficiency, reduce errors and enable better stock management.

industry_definition: The General Warehousing and Storage industry in the United States provides storage and warehousing services for general merchandise, refrigerated goods, household items and other products.
key_trends: Increased demand for warehousing due to growth in e-commerce sales
Adoption of automation and technology to improve efficiency
Consolidation and mergers & acquisitions activity in the industry
Outsourcing of logistics and warehouse management by businesses

market_segmentation.segment_description: Online sales often involve third-party warehousing as a necessity since businesses require physical locations for storing inventory before dispatch to customers, enhancing operational efficiency. Goods warehoused for online retailers tend to require more logistics support because they're packed and shipped to individual destinations rather than being palletized for bulk shipment. The industry faces challenges amid downstream consolidation because big-box stores, like Walmart, are intensifying in-house warehousing functions, reducing reliance on external service providers for supply chain management.

Manufacturers and other segments often use these facilities to store various items like machinery, metals, lumber, construction hardware, raw materials like textiles, automotive parts and excess inventory for future use. Manufacturers' warehouse space can become stressed and overwhelmed when production facilities operate at a higher capacity. Consequently, this increases demand for third-party storage facilities.

products_and_services.product_description: Manufacturers have increasingly turned to third-party logistics companies to coordinate facets of supply chain management. These offerings generally fall into the handling services segment. E-commerce has significantly boosted demand for general storage and warehousing services, as they can provide cost-effective storage and fulfillment services for online retailers.

Amid rising competition, general storage and warehousing companies must enhance their services with value-added processes like packing and transportation to effectively meet customer demands. As clients demand comprehensive door-to-door transportation networks, value-added services will significantly grow in importance. Currently, the industry primarily offers short-distance, less-than-truckload shipping services.

Automated storage systems allow goods to be stored in a space-efficient way while minimizing labor costs and improving safety. It can precisely pick and store items and uses advanced technologies like AI, robotics and sensors to streamline the storage and retrieval process. Smart warehouses use RFID tags, sensors and other technologies to monitor and control the entire storage and retrieval process, from automated checkout to tracking inventory; this allows for faster, more accurate, and efficient picking and packing and real-time optimization.

Companies have increasingly turned to supply chain management (SCM) applications to improve operational performance, reduce inventory and lower costs. Interest in improving execution will continue, with supply chain event management (SCEM) rapidly becoming one of the most sought-after functionalities in helping companies achieve greater visibility in their increasingly fragmented supply chains.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: E-commerce has risen, which has been particularly beneficial for the industry. Online sales heavily rely on third-party warehousing because many businesses don't have physical locations.
Customers must commit to a company's services for an extended period, stabilizing revenue streams somewhat.
Contract distribution to third-party logistics providers has grown as commercial and retail activity has increased.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is densely populated, housing many of the nation's people. It also boasts numerous establishments like automotive manufacturing and food and beverage.
The Great Lakes region is the hub of US manufacturing, especially heavy industry. This area is pivotal to the production of automobiles, machinery and other substantial goods.

The region not only has a large population but, similar to the West, also benefits from its proximity to large ports, providing easy access to imports and exports. The importation of a diverse range of goods from Europe and Africa necessitates significant storage facilities along the Atlantic coast to accommodate the influx of products.

barriers_points.barrier_description: General storage and warehousing are subject to a low level of regulation. Still, several licensing laws impact warehouse companies, depending on the type of goods they store.

Setting up general storage and warehousing has a low capital cost. Apart from buildings, companies rely on capital equipment like forklifts, pallets and racks to handle goods, although most machinery requires further labor.
Although some companies have moved into value-added services to attract and retain customers, there are limited opportunities to differentiate basic warehousing services on factors other than cost.

basis_points.basis_title: Use the most efficient work practices
basis_points.basis_description: Minimizing labor costs and promoting good industrial relations are essential, as the industry is relatively labor-intensive.
A warehouse design that caters to clients' specific products accommodates clients' needs.

basis_points.basis_title: Operate in a location that is close to key markets
basis_points.basis_description: General storage and warehousing facilities must be located geographically within or near population centers. Customers prefer to travel short distances to access their stores.
General storage and warehousing should establish strategic links with key markets to ensure a consistent workflow.

concentration_points.concentration_title: General storage and warehousing are highly fragmented
concentration_points.concentration_description: The highly fragmented nature can be attributed to many small- to mid-sized storage facilities that cater exclusively to local or regional demand.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Consolidation is accelerating at a rapid pace
concentration_points.concentration_description: Rapid growth in e-commerce has spurred warehouse consolidation, driven by the need for technological advancements to manage warehouses efficiently. This trend highlights the increasing complexity of modern warehouse management.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rental payments for warehouse space have decreased because of increased wage costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The expansion of e-commerce and consumers' increased expectations of short delivery times have led to growth in warehouses in densely populated urban areas, where rental costs are exceptionally high. Rising demand for services has exponentially outgrown available warehouse space. This imbalance in supply and demand has triggered a significant surge in warehouse rental rates.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit is shrinking as wages climb
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The increased labor intensity of industry operations has led to a slight hike in wage costs, which, together with growing rental prices, have constrained profit growth. The COVID-19 pandemic significantly impacted industries in 2020 and 2021, causing a reduction in profits. However, the boost in e-commerce provided critical support, facilitating continued commerce and profit-making during these challenging times.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages are the industry's highest cost
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The continual hike in wages can be largely attributed to the escalating demand for warehousing because of e-commerce expansion, requiring more labor for goods storage and distribution. While RFID tags and inventory tracking technology have significantly automated warehouse processes, human labor is still vital. Tasks like packing, handling delicate items and quality checks still require human intervention.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The chart displays current year only in the PDF version of this report.
volatility_points.volatility_description: The chart shows the trend for the current year, which is not available in the provided content.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Wages are the industry's highest cost
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: While RFID tags and inventory tracking technology have significantly automated warehouse processes, human labor is still vital. Tasks like packing, handling delicate items and quality checks still require human intervention.

FAQs.question: What is the industry's largest cost component?
FAQs.answer: The largest cost component for the industry is Wages at 44.2% of revenue.

FAQs.question: How have rental payments for warehouse space changed and why?
FAQs.answer: Rental payments for warehouse space have decreased as a revenue share because of increased wage costs. However, demand for services has outpaced existing warehouse space, increasing rental fees.

FAQs.question: How has profit been impacted and what are the reasons?
FAQs.answer: Profit is shrinking as wages climb. The increased labor intensity of industry operations has led to a hike in wage costs, which together with growing rental prices, have constrained profit growth.

FAQs.question: Why are wages the industry's highest cost?
FAQs.answer: Wages are the industry's highest cost due to the continual hike in wages largely attributed to the escalating demand for warehousing because of e-commerce expansion, requiring more labor for goods storage and distribution.
